text:
I know that -projecthelp was changed to not list any targets without 
descriptions, to distinguish public ones from private ones, but it doesnt list 
any targets if none of them have descriptors:

>ant -projecthelp
Buildfile: build.xml
Main targets:


Default target: archive


realistically, and to be backwards compatible with existing targets, we should 
have a list all targets mode which kicks in the moment no targets have a 
description. Or a special projecthelp option to list all targets regardless 
(actually that may not be a bad thing on its own)
creator: steve_l@iseran.com

text:
"ant -projecthelp -verbose" will list all targets regardless of whether or not 
they have documentation. I guess we could detect the special case of zero 
documentation on any targets and then kick in the "display all" functionality. 
We could also give a nice big UGLY warning telling the users they should 
document their build file ;)
creator: donaldp@apache.org

text:
wouldn't it be better to have an additional attribute (eg. public=true/false) 
to indicate public targets and then have the -projecthelp list only those 
targets and list all targets if none of the targets is public ?
creator: gert.driesen@ardatis.com

text:
the trouble with that is people would rightfully expect the modifier to alter 
accessibility of targets from the command line or via <ant>, which is quite 
fundamental.
creator: steve_l@iseran.com
